result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek P. Moscinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA Surcharges.    If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent. 
Early Discharge option upon successful completetion and with recommendation of the Agent.

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Derek P. Moscinski in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  
14CF206 Ct 1 & 3:  W/H Sentence:  24 mo Probation:  Conditions:    AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately. Maintain fulltime employment. Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent. Early Discharge option upon successful completetion and with recommendation of the Agent. Pay costs + DNA surcharge.  14CF206 Ct #2 to be DRI.
13CM375 to be DRI.

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contests to 14CF206 ct 1 & 3
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF206 ct 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 14CF206 Ct #2 and 13CM375 are Dismissed Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing statements.
Atty Drury makes sentencing statements and request 18 months probation.
